alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 6:54PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 830 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 PM HST, radar showed locally heavy rain continuing over the South Kona and portions of the North Kona Districts. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Heaviest rain showers remain focused between Honaunau, Captain Cook and Holualoa. Current radar trends show rainfall rates beginning to diminish, however additional heavy showers are expected through early evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kailua-Kona, Captain Cook, Honaunau, Kealakekua, Kainaliu, Honalo, Kahaluu-Keauhou, Holualoa, Hawaiian Ocean View, Kalaoa, Milolii, Hawaii Volcanoes Park Kahuku Unit and Kona International Airport. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 830 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
